website_summaries.verdict: Although this trolling motor is specifically designed for Intex inflatables, it may also fit other inflatable boats that have built-in motor mount fittings.
pros: This Intex trolling motor is an affordable option with 40-pound thrust, 8 speeds, and a 36-in
It comes with a number of impressive features such as the weed escape button, which rotates the propeller back and forth to help disengage the blade from a tangle situation
cons: When it works, it is an incredible motor
Unfortunately, the quality from unit to unit can vary drastically

customer_reviews.title: Works ok, when it works...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this motor for three years, and I am not happy with it. Last year, it started to run for 3 seconds, then shut off. Run for 3 seconds, then shut off. Repeat, repeat. Finally it gets going and will run for hours no problem. But when I first hit the switch to get it going, that’s when I need it to work - otherwise I’m slamming into docks, the shore, other boats, etc. It is no longer reliable. I will be buying a Minn Kota to replace this awful product. Thought I would take a chance on a cheaper product, and now I am paying for it.
customer_reviews.author: David Koser

customer_reviews.title: First few weeks were great, but last weekend i went to depress the ...
customer_reviews.text: First few weeks were great, but last weekend i went to depress the red tilt button to lower the motor into the water and it snapped. This has made the entire thing useless because it's impossible to manually move the tabs while the motor is on the mount. Otherwise i had been satisfied with it. It worked great for use on my private pond. It does get caught up on weeds/algae very easy but the weed button or some clever throttle management and movements breaks it loose quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Nogoer

customer_reviews.title: Update
customer_reviews.text: Received the item and had to contact Intex because it was not working. Now I have to wait for them to send me a new one, which is nice but a bummer the first one wasn’t good. Not thrilled with it.
customer_reviews.author: J-Rod

customer_reviews.title: Good initially
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well for a year. Now it will shut off after several seconds as if the out of water safety mode is being activated. After several attempts it will finally run as normal but only in the 5 and reverse 3 settings.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This Intex Trolling Motor works great with my Intex Inflatable Seahawk 4
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Boler

customer_reviews.title: Trolling motor
customer_reviews.text: Took it out for my first trip out on the boat. It did really well the first day! Unfortunately I had a bad battery that would not recharge so I was unable to use it again after that, but I am very pleased with the way it operated taking it out for the first time. Can’t wait to get out and use it again. I have mine mounted on an intex excursion 5 inflatable boat, my mother, my kids and myself were all in the boat and we were able to troll around for quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Quinones

customer_reviews.title: Dead On Arrival, Returned for Refund
customer_reviews.text: After reading the mixed reviews, I decided to take a chance and try the Intex motor. The unit I received was defective. The only thing that worked was the battery meter. The motor was dead. Thanks to Amazon Prime's admirable return policy, I was able to return it easily so nothing lost except time. I bought the Minn Kota Endura C2 30 which is similarly priced (although rated lower in thrust) and it works great on my 16' canoe.
customer_reviews.author: Melodic_agony

customer_reviews.title: Good addition to my rafts.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Mariner 3 and 4. These little motors work really well and were worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Uses battery quickly
customer_reviews.text: When paired with the recommended battery ... it will last 45 mins on " HI " and about ninety mins on low .
customer_reviews.author: R A Murillo

customer_reviews.title: Starts and stops
customer_reviews.text: This motor is not very good. Same problem as other consumers. Motor will just stop,shut it down and start again and it goes very slow and then stops. Very disappointed with this product. Will be buying another brand
customer_reviews.author: ann m serio

customer_reviews.title: Nice and quiet
customer_reviews.text: Nice and quiet. Very good quality. Haven’t left it outside in the rain yet but I’m very happy with purchase
customer_reviews.author: Erik Flornes

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good little motor. Some issues with power control on low battery.
customer_reviews.author: William H.

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful
customer_reviews.text: Pretty strong motor. Pushes my Intex Excursion 5 very well.
customer_reviews.author: O. Sallah

customer_reviews.title: Salt water 24/7 excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little motor. I have it on a Intex Mariner 3, in salt water 24 hours a day through wind and rain and have had no problems. Runs every time.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Carey

customer_reviews.title: N/A
customer_reviews.text: Better than what some reviews say. We'll have to wait and see if it holds up another year for the rest of the review.
customer_reviews.author: shawn bowman

customer_reviews.title: Only one gear worked, sometimes
customer_reviews.text: It only worked in one gear , reverse -3 . What a waste!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just awesome! Durable too!
customer_reviews.text: This motor is awesome. Powerful enough to haul a boat with 4 people and doesn't take that much energy out of the battery. Also, propellers didn't break when it hit some rocks a few times. Thank you for that!
customer_reviews.author: Aleks Nevski

customer_reviews.title: It's easy to mount on the bracket
customer_reviews.text: We purchased an Intex rubber inflatable boat along with the mount and this trolling motor. It's easy to mount on the bracket, has a quiet, if not silent motor and is zippy and gets the boat to where we want it to go. Adjusts for lower water levels with rocks, etc. We are very pleased thus far. Thank you Intex for making an affordable way to get out on the water for a relaxing day of trolling, fishing and fun!
customer_reviews.author: P. Hepler

customer_reviews.title: works great. it pushed us along the river just fine
customer_reviews.text: works great. it pushed us along the river just fine. love that it is so quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Aubrey Sundquist

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not very good quality. It stops frequently when changing speeds. Save your money and go for a minkota
customer_reviews.author: damian crosby

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband as a Christmas gift. He went to use it for the first time yesterday morning and it does not work. At All.
customer_reviews.author: renee

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works good, used it 3 trips so far. Can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kateri Bird

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately the product didn't work. It only had one ...
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the product didn't work. It only had one speed when we used it, so it didn't work for fishing. We missed the return window on Amazon because we were trying to use it while we were on vacation. We submitted a warranty claim to Intex. Hopefully we get one that works. I will update my review after we receive a trolling motor that works.
customer_reviews.author: Brad J Helgason

customer_reviews.title: Had an Issue
customer_reviews.text: For the most part I like the design of the unit, but my tilt mechanism broke the first time out. Intex/Windy City says they will replace it when in stock, but not sure when that will be (especially since I see they show it available for sale on the web at any given time). As stated in other reviews, customer service has been horrible. I have gotten various answers at different times and feel like they just make returns as hard as possible so you will give up. I'll see what happens and send an update once this is resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Bonde

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Does not last more than 30-45 minutes. Ive tried three brand new deep cycle marine batteries which all had more than enough power to run this motor. As soon as I would turn it on the battery power light on the motor showed half energy. I'll be returning, and if that's a problem I will dispute the charge on my card due to incorrect product. That will get my money from Intex no matter how crap their customer service or product is. Bottom line...just don't buy this motor.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: I really enjoyed the functionality of it
customer_reviews.text: Used it once so far. I really enjoyed the functionality of it. Pushes my Intex Mariner 4 with ease. Couple things to take into account. 1- The angle adjuster feature that controls trim seams to be pretty cheap and may break after a while. 2- Battery guage on control head doesn't appear to be too accurate. Other than that, Compared to other brands, I'd say this is the best bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: Droid44

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Product was better than expected!!! I am a very satisfied customer and the Trolling Motor ran better than I had expected!!! I highly recommend this product to anyone who has an inflatable boat....BEATS ROWING... lol
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Got a good deal and cheaper than competitor motors - We'll see ...
customer_reviews.text: Got a good deal and cheaper than competitor motors - We'll see how it holds up compared to Minn Kota but works great so far. Battery meter is definitely off which is why the 3 stars - Mine went from full to red in first 30 minutes of use but then I continued use for 6 more hours on 29 DC marine battery. When returned to battery charger still had 56% in battery. As far as ease of use, weight and power, great.
customer_reviews.author: dzelko

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with amazon
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT.!!!! This was the second unit I went through. The handle is defective and slips constantly when moving into gear. Amazon has the nerve of charging me a restocking fee on top of it. Very disappointed with amazon , they went downhill bigtime!
customer_reviews.author: smiley

customer_reviews.title: It works great for the inflatable boat
customer_reviews.text: or the Marinar 4. It works great for the inflatable boat. I do wish the control handle was longer so I wouldn't have to sit over the battery to steer.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce R.

customer_reviews.title: The motor was fine for the 4 months that it worked
customer_reviews.text: The motor was fine for the 4 months that it worked. However, it stalled in the middle of the intercoastal and eventually restarted, (through prayer). Once we got back to land, it would not restart. We were able to use the motor for less than a dozen times. But, because it is passed the 30 days return policy, we wasted the money. This is very disappointing and makes the rest of our purchase for the motor mount, battery and boat, completely useless.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Green

customer_reviews.title: This motor is well made !
customer_reviews.text: This motor is well made ! I put it on the Excursion 4 man inflatable boat it has power to spare.
customer_reviews.author: Art Lover 63

customer_reviews.title: I am pretty displease at the fact that I now have this ...
customer_reviews.text: The engine cuts off apparently for no reason at all. I'm under the impression that there some sort of electrical short however I just haven't had the time to troubleshoot it. Either way, I am pretty displease at the fact that I now have this challenge to deal with
customer_reviews.author: qwidixirxsuweuzdcv

customer_reviews.title: Ill get back to this review
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to work alright I guess u till the boat sank and left me swimming in the dark. I can't figure out how to contact intex direct but amazon is sending me a new boat. They don't know if I can get new trolling motor or mount. It was Lil scary I was just glad I didn't have my kids
customer_reviews.author: Austin B.

customer_reviews.title: great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works great. The battery indicator lights do not seem to be very accurate but besides that it does pretty good on my 12' aluminum john boat.
customer_reviews.author: Slim Angle

customer_reviews.title: Will post another review after I use it the next ...
customer_reviews.text: Will post another review after I use it the next two weeks extensively but as deceiving as the pictures are and the lack of product description, it does NOT come with the motor mount. Says you need the battery, but doesn't say you need the mount even though it's in the picture. More to follow...
customer_reviews.author: Kristie T.

customer_reviews.title: I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Intex Trolling Motor only once so far. It is to soon to tell how it will last. At this point, I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great but recommend two batteries so you do not get stranded.
customer_reviews.author: Luann B.

customer_reviews.title: gotta have it
customer_reviews.text: this motor is good for fishing or when u just want to get around on a lake or pond. it has great acceleration and i highly recomend it
customer_reviews.author: jay seeber jr

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I`m using the motor on a 14' canoe and it works extremely well. It`s a great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: hydroman

customer_reviews.title: It really works great, BUT don't get it wet!!!
customer_reviews.text: This motor has lots of power, it pushed my 16' sailboat great, but when I accidentally dropped into the water, for two seconds, that was the end...the unit is NOT water proof. AND if you let it get submerged for ANY REASON the warranty goes VOID. It's a boat motor...wouldn't you think that maybe the things going to get wet sometimes...I wouldn't think it would be too hard to make it at least, water resistant..........so, don't waste your money on this unless you plan on keeping from getting wet.
customer_reviews.author: ez mon

customer_reviews.title: Got caught in a rain storm and it just quit ...
customer_reviews.text: Got caught in a rain storm and it just quit and left me paddling for about a mile in high surf on the ocean. Seems that the return time is 9 days passed, can't seem to get a hold of anyone to help with a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Mark E.

customer_reviews.title: Great motor
customer_reviews.text: Works really good It is very powerful...really worth the money I really believe you cant go wrong with Intex....Im so glad I bought this
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Monroe

customer_reviews.title: loved the Intex Transom Mount Trolling Motor
customer_reviews.text: I am 62 and love to fish with my sister we just love it as it is lite weight and easy to use I have recommended the Intex to many people while fishing and had a lot of enquiries and complements. Thank you Patricia Phelan

customer_reviews.title: nice motor
customer_reviews.text: I have only useed this motor a couple of times. it works very well on my inflatable boat. it has good power and speed.

customer_reviews.title: easy to steer
customer_reviews.text: a must have for any day on the lake. plenty of power, easy to steer, and light weight. had mine for two years and loving it still

customer_reviews.text: Im not sure what to expect from intex trolling motor,but the first time I'm using the trolling motor it's work beyond my expectation,especially when u use speed no 5 you can feel the kick,all I can say the things work just fine and my only hope is the material that they are using would not rust in salt water,to intex please advise me what should I do after every used in salt water to prevent my intex trolling from getting rusty and to maintain it,thank u intex
customer_reviews.author: Sani

customer_reviews.title: love it workes asum the bat gage is off ses ...
customer_reviews.text: love it workes asum the bat gage is off ses the bat is close to ded but still go haf the day on it but dont take my werd for it and get stranded
customer_reviews.author: Andrew W.

customer_reviews.title: he tells me it is nice.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son. so I haven't see it, he tells me it is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy C

customer_reviews.title: Still in a box
customer_reviews.text: I didn't get to use it last year but it came on time. I came in great packaging and not a scratch on the box.
customer_reviews.author: Digin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: don't want to tell a lie I have not had time to put it on my boat
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Decent motor, but I know better..
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of homework on these. Ended up purchasing Minn Kota Endura MAX. Paid $140 (after hitting their site for a $20 rebate). The MAX lasted through a lake fishing/camping trip over the weekend on one battery. Trolling the whooole weekend. Plus, it had 45lb thrust which helped me "plow" through the sheet of ice on top of the water. Moral of the story is.. if your going to drop $100+ on a trolling motor, then get best for a few more bucks!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Nickolson

customer_reviews.title: It's a simple fix
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance like others due to the negative reviews. I opened up the box and hooked it up to my battery and it was dead on arrival. First thing I did was get a test light and checked power at the main board and there was none. It turns out it was just a poor solder job. I ended up just squeezing the connector on the battery clip and it works perfect. I will most likely be getting new clips for piece of mind but it was such a simple fix.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan hBradford

customer_reviews.title: don't buy for seawater
customer_reviews.text: bought it from amazon, arrived to kuwait and was very excited , it worked for a few days then it was busted due to humidity. if ur in a humid environment don't you even think of buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Reem Alqatami

customer_reviews.title: I liked it before it quit on me
customer_reviews.text: This motor Quit twice one Me.I had to row back home 2 times . I liked it before it quit on me. I ordered a Minn Cota
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bird

customer_reviews.title: Intex should have the worst rating in BBB
customer_reviews.text: Worst customer service on the planet for any of their products. Good products, as long as they work they are awesome. When they break you are done!
customer_reviews.author: Tomer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This little motor just pushed my Seahawk 4 around my local reservoir with no problems. Fast enough when it needs to be & perfect trolling speeds. I am very happy to have bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Jason G

customer_reviews.title: Battery meter inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: This motor is great and has enough power to get you around even on the bay with wind and tides!! The only problem I am having with it after trying 3 new batteries ( diehard, ever start and duralast marine deep cycle batteries) is the battery meter is not reliable. It will drop from 4 to 3 right away, then stay on three for an hour than drop to one and skip 2. Also the motor will randomly stop when switching speeds sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas M.

customer_reviews.title: Does it include the mount? As in the photo?
customer_reviews.text: Hello, anyone who purchased -- could you please let me/us know if this comes with the mounting kit/board as in the photo? thanks!
customer_reviews.author: tati

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy unless you feeling lucky you wont have any problems
customer_reviews.text: Battery meter stinks faulty?. No help from INTEX Will never buy from INTEX again cause there service stinks....wish I never bought this motor...headache...
customer_reviews.author: free

product_meta.title: Intex Trolling Motor for Intex Inflatable Boats, 36" Shaft
product_meta.description:
The Intex Trolling Motor is the perfect addition to an Intex boat, and is able to fit most Intex boat models, including: the Challenger 3; the Seahawk 2, 3, 4; the Excursion 3, 4, 5 and the Mariner 3 and 4 boats. This extremely quiet motor has a digital maximizer control module and water cooling system that supply only the necessary power this motor needs in order to go the desired speed making the motor more efficient and providing longer running times. The boater will be able to, more effectively, control the boat speed in changing environments as well. The motor's "Soft Start" function helps to increase the motor's life through limiting how fast the motor can go from "OFF" to "ON." Suitable for freshwater and saltwater adventures, the tilt⁄extend tiller makes handling a breeze and the weed escape mode helps the motor get out of weed tangles.

The Intex Trolling Motor is compatible with most inflatable boats that have built-in motor mount fittings. Includes: A control panel with the following controls: Battery meter, automatic escape weed control key, dry operation protect, overload protect. Adjustable handle: Handle tilts upward: 45, 30, 15, 0 degrees . Handle tilts downward: 0 - 75 degrees. Handles extends 6 inches (15cm). Handle speed control: Forward: 5 speeds, OFF, Reverse: 3 speeds. Permanent magnet motor: Digital maximizer control module. Water cooling system. Adjustable mounting bracket: Clamp Screws, Tilt Lock lever, Quick release depth collar and lever arm, Steering tension knob.

Maximum Power (W): 420W. Voltage: 12V DC. Thrust: 40 lbs/180N. Shaft length in inches: 36 (91.40cm). Suitable for: Freshwater and saltwater. Requires (not included): A deep cycle marine 12 volt battery with at least 60 ampere hours rating.
feature_bullets: Designed for Intex boats, includes Challenger 3, Seahawk 2, 3, 4, Excursion 3, 4, 5 and Mariner 3 and 4. Compatible with most inflatable boats that have built-in motor mount fittings
Control panel: Battery meter, automatic escape weed control key, dry operation protect, overload protect controls
Adjustable handle: Handle tilts upward: 45, 30, 15, 0 degrees . Handle tilts downward: 0 – 75 degrees. Handles extends 6 inches (15cm). Handle speed control: Forward: 5 speeds, OFF, Reverse: 3 speeds
Maximum Power (W): 420W. Voltage: 12V DC. Thrust: 40 lbs/180N. Shaft length in inches: 36 (91.40cm). Suitable for: Freshwater and saltwater
Requires (not included): A deep cycle marine 12 volt battery with at least 60 ampere hours rating
